greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Theta series of D_5 lattice.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) := Prod_{k>=1} (1-(-q)^k) (see A121373), phi(q) := theta_3(q) := Sum_{k=-oo..oo} q^(k^2) (A000122), psi(q) := Sum_{k=0..oo} q^(k*(k+1)/2) (A010054), chi(q) := Prod_{k>=0} (1+q^(2k+1)) (A000700).
reference: J. H. Conway and N. J. A. Sloane, "Sphere Packings, Lattices and Groups", Springer-Verlag, p. 118.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
link: John Cannon, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5000
G. Nebe and N. J. A. Sloane, Home page for this lattice
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of ( phi(q)^5 + phi(-q)^5 ) / 2 in powers of q^2 where phi() is a Ramanujan theta function. - _Michael Somos_, Sep 14 2007
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (16 t)) = 64 2^(1/2) (t/i)^(5/2) g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is g.f. for A008422.
mathematica: terms = 44; phi[q_] := EllipticTheta[3, 0, q]; s = (phi[q]^5 + phi[-q]^5)/2 + O[q]^(2 terms); DeleteCases[CoefficientList[s, q], 0][[1 ;; terms]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 04 2017, after _Michael Somos_ *)
program: (PARI) {a(n)=if(n<0, 0, n*=2; polcoeff( sum(k=1, sqrtint(n), 2*x^k^2, 1+x*O(x^n))^5, n))} /* _Michael Somos_, Nov 03 2006 */
xref: A000132(2n) = a(n). A008422 gives dual lattice.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
